summary: The Save Our Small Farms Act of 2025 amends the Federal Agriculture Improvement and Reform Act of 1996. It focuses on transitioning producers from the Noninsured Crop Assistance Program (NAP) to the whole farm revenue insurance plan. Key provisions include streamlining the application process, offering premium discounts for transitioning producers, expanding crop listings, and establishing pilot projects. The bill also addresses loss appraisal procedures, increases assistance limits for certain farmers, and promotes outreach to eligible producers.
